channel.title: Anyone ever finish a c++ port?
channel.description: I was wondering if anyone had ever finished a c++ port of a private server because I love rs and rsps's but I'm only good with c++. so, anyone...?

item.title: Anyone ever finish a c++ port?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:7, topic:317023”]You guys are idiots… By “port” he means a C++ distribution of a runescape private server.

“In computer science, porting is the process of adapting software so that an executable program can be created for a computing environment that is …”

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_(software)[/quote]i thot port wuz 43594??!?/

Anyways, someone made one… sspoke, or another name he uses which I don’t remember. Here’s his topic.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone ever finish a c++ port?

item.title: Anyone ever finish a c++ port?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:7, topic:317023”]You guys are idiots… By “port” he means a C++ distribution of a runescape private server.

“In computer science, porting is the process of adapting software so that an executable program can be created for a computing environment that is …”

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_(software)[/quote]

For some reason I assumed that by port he meant about how you use ports for socket connections.

How silly of me, as these are socket connecting servers. -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone ever finish a c++ port?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You guys are idiots… By “port” he means a C++ distribution of a runescape private server.

“In computer science, porting is the process of adapting software so that an executable program can be created for a computing environment that is …”

en.wikipedia.org

Porting

In software engineering, porting is the process of adapting software for the purpose of achieving some form of execution in a computing environment that is different from the one that a given program (meant for such execution) was originally designed for (e.g. different CPU, operating system, or third party library). The term is also used when software/hardware is changed to make them usable in different environments. Software is portable when the cost of porting it to a new platform is signific...

Read full topic
